title: Prek: forbid Cyrillic characters (strict)
description:
Goal: Enforce a repo-wide policy: no Cyrillic characters in tracked files.

Why:
- Keep code/config/docs consistent and easy to search/review.

How:
- Add a prek hook that scans staged/all files for `\p{Script=Cyrillic}` and fails on matches.

Done when:
- `uvx prek run no-cyrillic --all-files` passes.
- The hook fails when Cyrillic is introduced.
close_reason: Added prek hook + script to block Cyrillic in non-translation files; documented policy in AGENTS.md.

title: Pipeline core: Phase trait + Pipeline runner + Orchestrator loop (integration tests)
description:
Goal: Implement the pipeline core: Phase trait, Pipeline runner, and Orchestrator loop with Storage.

Why:
- This is the project backbone: phases must plug in without rewriting the core.

How:
- Phase: name() + run(state, ctx) -> state.
- Pipeline: ordered list of phases from config.
- Orchestrator: init_run, iterate, evaluate stop conditions, update best/stagnation.
- Append history events per step (generated/scored/selected/.../stopped).

TDD:
- First test: a pipeline of 1-2 dummy phases mutates state; history is written; stop by max_rounds.

Done when:
- A minimal end-to-end mock integration test creates `runs/<run_id>/` and `history.ndjson`.

title: Repo tooling: prek hooks + instructions (TDD + what/why/how)
description:
Goal: Add prek (pre-commit compatible) and document standards for tasks/commits (what/why/how) and TDD cadence.

Why:
- Fast feedback loop before pushes (fmt/clippy/tests + repo hygiene).
- Consistent writing: tasks/commits should explain not only what, but also why/how.

How:
- Add `.pre-commit-config.yaml` and document usage (`uvx prek run`, `uvx prek install`).
- Update `AGENTS.md` templates and TDD cadence section.

Done when:
- `uvx prek validate-config .pre-commit-config.yaml` passes.
- `uvx prek run --all-files` passes.
- `AGENTS.md` includes commit + bd templates with What/Why/How.
close_reason: Added .pre-commit-config.yaml, updated AGENTS templates with What/Why/How + TDD, validated prek run.

title: LlmProvider: Mock provider + deterministic fixtures for generator/critic/merger/mutator/refiner
description:
Goal: Implement a deterministic MockLlmProvider with fixtures for generator/critic/merger/mutator/refiner/final.

Why:
- We need deterministic unit/integration tests without external LLM calls.

How:
- Define an LlmTask enum (Generator/Critic/Merger/Mutator/Refiner/Final).
- Return fixture JSON based on task type + iteration.

TDD:
- First tests: each LlmTask returns valid JSON; unknown scenario returns a clear error.

Done when:
- Integration tests can run 2-4 iterations fully via the mock provider.

title: CLI: run/resume/show/validate (MVP) + integration tests for artifacts
description:
Goal: Implement MVP CLI commands: run (mock), show (json/md), validate (artifact checks).

Why:
- CLI is the user interface; MVP DoD requires deterministic runs and artifacts.

How:
- `run`: parse flags, run orchestrator, print run_id.
- `show`: read state/final and render json or markdown.
- `validate`: verify artifacts exist and basic invariants hold (JSON parses, best_idea_id exists, etc.).

TDD:
- First integration test: `evoidea run --mode mock --prompt ... --out <temp>` creates the expected files.

Done when:
- Commands match `evoidea_codex_bundle_md/docs/06_CLI.md` (we can start with a subset but keep it stable).

title: Scaffold: Rust crate + clap/tracing deps + cargo test baseline
description:
Goal: Create the baseline Rust crate `evoidea` (CLI binary) at the repo root.

Why:
- We need a scaffold to start TDD and wire up prek gates (fmt/clippy/tests).

How:
- Initialize a bin crate (`cargo init --bin --name evoidea`) with edition 2021.
- Add deps: `clap`, `tracing`, `tracing-subscriber`, `serde`, `serde_json`, `anyhow` (and `thiserror` if needed).
- Add a minimal CLI with a stub `run` subcommand.

TDD:
- First test: argument parsing / `--help` smoke (if applicable).

Done when:
- `cargo fmt`, `cargo clippy -- -D warnings`, `cargo test` pass.
- `cargo run -- --help` and `cargo run -- run --help` work.

title: Optional: evals harness (prompts csv + node runner) to sanity-check skill output
description:
Goal: Add an optional eval harness (dataset + runner) to sanity-check skill output structure.

Why:
- We want regression-style e2e checks without judging "idea quality".

How:
- Materialize `evals/evo-ideator.prompts.csv` and `evals/run-evals.mjs`.
- Runner invokes `codex exec --json` and validates event/final structure.

Done when:
- Evals can be run locally and produce a clear pass/fail report.

title: LlmProvider: CodexExecProvider (codex exec --output-schema) + optional smoke test
description:
Goal: Implement CodexExecProvider (run `codex exec --output-schema`) and an optional smoke test.

Why:
- This enables the real (non-mock) mode and makes the project useful.

How:
- Spawn `codex exec` with explicit args, timeout, and clear errors.
- Use tempfile for intermediate files.
- Support `--search` and `--skip-git-repo-check` if needed.

TDD:
- First tests: command-line argument assembly (no real subprocess in unit tests).
- Optional smoke/e2e behind an env var to keep CI deterministic.

Done when:
- `--mode codex` can run 1-2 steps without crashing and writes artifacts.

title: evoidea MVP: Rust CLI + evo-ideator skill (IDEATION-only, mock-first)
description:
Goal: Ship the evoidea MVP: a local Rust CLI plus the evo-ideator Codex skill (IDEATION-only, mock-first).

Why:
- Deterministic tests and runs via a mock LLM provider.
- Extensible architecture (Phase/Storage/LlmProvider) without rewrites.

How:
- Follow the spec bundle in `evoidea_codex_bundle_md/docs/` and the MVP design in `docs/plans/2026-01-23-evoidea-mvp-design.md`.
- Build a vertical slice first: FileStorage + MockLlmProvider + minimal phases + `evoidea run`.

Done when:
- `cargo test` is green.
- `cargo run -- run --mode mock --prompt "..."` creates `runs/<run_id>/` and writes `final.json` with exactly one best idea.
- `.codex/skills/evo-ideator` runs via the materialized script.

title: Phases: Crossover + Mutation (provider merger/mutator) with invariants (tests)
description:
Goal: Add Crossover and Mutation phases to generate new ideas with parents/origin invariants.

Why:
- Variation is required: new ideas should not come only from the initial generator.

How:
- Crossover: pick pairs from top-M by score, call merger, add crossover_count ideas with parents.
- Mutation: pick ideas (top + random), pick mutation_type, call mutator, add mutation_count ideas with parents.
- Maintain invariants for origin/parents/gen.

TDD:
- First integration test: new ideas appear with origin=crossover/mutated, non-empty parents, and incremented gen.

Done when:
- Tests pass and history includes crossover/mutated events.

title: Phase: Select (elite + diversity) updates population + best (tests)
description:
Goal: Implement SelectPhase: apply selection, update best, and archive eliminated ideas.

Why:
- After scoring we must keep population size stable and track the current winner/stagnation.

How:
- Use the pure selection logic.
- Mark eliminated ideas as status=archived so they do not participate further.
- Append history event: selected.

TDD:
- First integration test: active ideas == population_size; archived excluded; best_idea_id matches max overall_score.

Done when:
- Tests pass and stop conditions receive correct best/stagnation inputs.

title: Phases: Generate + Critic (apply score patches) with MockLlmProvider (tests)
description:
Goal: Implement Generate and Critic phases using MockLlmProvider (ideas + score patches).

Why:
- This is the first functional slice that produces ideas and assigns scores for selection.

How:
- GeneratePhase: call provider.generator and add ideas up to population_size.
- CriticPhase: call provider.critic and apply patches; compute overall_score in code.
- Append history events: generated, scored.

TDD:
- First integration test: after Generate we have N ideas; after Critic scores/judge_notes/overall_score are populated.

Done when:
- Tests pass and data model invariants hold.

title: Scoring/Selection: weighted sum + elite+diversity selection (unit tests)
description:
Goal: Implement overall score calculation (weighted sum) and elite+diversity selection logic.

Why:
- Selection is the core of the evolutionary loop; it must be correct and regression-tested.

How:
- Compute overall_score from per-criterion scores (0..10) using RunConfig weights.
- Implement selection: top elite_count + a small number of diversity slots (seeded).
- Ignore status=archived.

TDD:
- First tests: elite_count preserved; population bounded; diversity is not always top-only; archived excluded.

Done when:
- Unit tests are green and logic is pure (no IO / provider).

title: Stop conditions: threshold/stagnation/max_rounds (unit tests)
description:
Goal: Implement stop conditions: threshold, stagnation, and max_rounds.

Why:
- The loop must stop predictably and quickly; incorrect stopping breaks usability and tests.

How:
- Extract a pure function: (iteration, best_score, prev_best_score, stagnation_counter, config) -> decision.
- Stagnation counter increases on no improvement and resets on improvement.

TDD:
- First tests: stop by threshold; stop by stagnation_patience; stop by max_rounds; no stop when improving.

Done when:
- Unit tests cover the scenarios from `evoidea_codex_bundle_md/docs/07_TEST_PLAN.md`.

title: Materialize spec bundle into repo root (docs/ + .codex/skills)
description:
Goal: Materialize the spec bundle into canonical repo paths (docs + skill).

Why:
- Make the repository self-contained and easy to navigate.
- Avoid relying on a nested "bundle" directory for day-to-day work.

How:
- Move/copy `evoidea_codex_bundle_md/docs/*` into `docs/spec/*` (or `docs/*` if we prefer).
- Move/copy `evoidea_codex_bundle_md/.codex/skills/evo-ideator/*` into `.codex/skills/evo-ideator/`.
- Update references and remove/archivize the bundle directory once migrated.

Done when:
- Specs and skill exist in the canonical locations.
- No code/docs in the main repo contain Cyrillic characters.

title: Phases: Refine top-K + Final composer writes final.json (tests)
description:
Goal: Implement RefinePhase (improve top-K) and finalize the run by writing final.json.

Why:
- Refinement makes the winner more actionable; finalization freezes the IDEATION output.

How:
- Refine: for top-K ideas, call provider.refiner and apply patch without changing identity/parentage.
- Final: write a FinalResult with exactly one best idea + why_won + scores.
- Append history: refined, stopped.

TDD:
- First integration test: refine changes fields; final.json contains exactly one idea and parses via serde.

Done when:
- `cargo run -- run --mode mock --prompt "..."` writes final.json with one best idea.

title: Materialize JSON schemas for structured outputs (schemas/*.json)
description:
Goal: Materialize JSON Schema files for structured outputs into `schemas/*.json`.

Why:
- CodexExecProvider needs `codex exec --output-schema` to enforce strict JSON.

How:
- Convert `evoidea_codex_bundle_md/non_md/schemas/SCHEMAS.json.md` blocks into real `schemas/*.json` files.
- Ensure objects use `additionalProperties: false`.

TDD:
- First test: files exist and are valid JSON (basic parse).

Done when:
- `schemas/*.json` exist and parse as JSON.

title: Storage: FileStorage writes runs/<run_id> artifacts + tests
description:
Goal: Implement FileStorage that writes `runs/<run_id>/` artifacts (config/state/history/final).

Why:
- Run artifacts are core MVP observability and a DoD requirement.

How:
- Implement a Storage trait: init_run/load_state/save_state/append_event/save_final.
- Store history as newline-delimited JSON (append-only).

TDD:
- First tests: init_run creates the directory; state round-trip; append_event writes NDJSON; save_final writes final.json.

Done when:
- Integration tests are green.
- Structure matches `evoidea_codex_bundle_md/docs/05_STORAGE.md`.

title: Data model: structs + JSON round-trip tests (RunConfig/Idea/State/Event/Final)
description:
Goal: Define the core data model (RunConfig/Idea/State/Event/FinalResult) and stable JSON serialization.

Why:
- These structs are the contract between phases, storage, CLI, and (later) schema-based LLM outputs.

How:
- Implement structs per `evoidea_codex_bundle_md/docs/02_DATA_MODEL.md`.
- Encode invariants: origin/parents/status/overall_score, etc.

TDD:
- First tests: JSON round-trip for State + invariants (parents/origin/status).

Done when:
- Unit tests cover round-trip and key invariants.
- `cargo test` is green.

title: Codex skill: materialize evo-ideator + run_evoidea.sh script (chmod +x)
description:
Goal: Materialize the `.codex/skills/evo-ideator` skill and the `run_evoidea.sh` script.

Why:
- DoD requires a working skill entry point for the "generate a single best idea" workflow.

How:
- Copy the skill markdown into `.codex/skills/evo-ideator/`.
- Materialize `.codex/skills/evo-ideator/scripts/run_evoidea.sh` from the non_md source and `chmod +x`.

TDD:
- First check: script exists and is executable (CI can at least verify file exists).

Done when:
- The skill can be discovered and executed locally via Codex.
